devdoc.author: Masa Finance
devdoc.details: Soulbound 2FA, that inherits from the SBT contract.

addAuthority(address).details: The caller must have the admin to call this function

addErc20Token(address).details: The caller must have the owner to call this function

burn(uint256).details: Burns `tokenId`. See {SBT-_burn}. Requirements: - The caller must own `tokenId` or be an approved operator.

constructor.details: Creates a new soulbound 2FA, inheriting from the SBT contract.

params._mintingPrice: Price of minting in stable coin

getErc20Tokens().details: Returns the address of all available ERC 20 tokens

returns._0: Array of all enabled ERC20 tokens

params.paymentMethod: Address of token that user want to pay

returns._0: Current price for minting in the given payment method

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

mint(address,address,address,uint256,byt.details: The caller must have the MINTER role

params.paymentMethod: Address of token that user want to pay
params.to: The address to mint the SBT to

returns._0: The SBT ID of the newly minted SBT

mint(address,uint256,address,uint256,byt.details: The caller must have the MINTER role

params.identityId: TokenId of the identity to mint the NFT to
params.paymentMethod: Address of token that user want to pay

returns._0: The NFT ID of the newly minted SBT

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

removeErc20Token(address).details: The caller must have the owner to call this function

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setMasaToken(address).details: The caller must have the owner to call this function It can be set to address(0) to disable paying in $MASA

params._masaToken: New utility token to pay the fee in

setMintingPrice(uint256).details: The caller must have the admin to call this function

params._mintingPrice: New price of minting in stable coin

setReserveWallet(address).details: Let change the reserve walled. It can be triggered by an authorized account.

setSoulboundIdentity(address).details: The caller must be the admin to call this function

setStableCoin(address).details: The caller must have the owner to call this function

params._stableCoin: New stable coin to pay the fee in

setSwapRouter(address).details: The caller must have the owner to call this function

setWrappedNativeToken(address).details: The caller must have the owner to call this function

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Interface identification is specified in ERC-165.

params.interfaceId: The interface identifier, as specified in ERC-165

returns._0: `true` if the contract implements `interfaceId` and  `interfaceId` is not 0xffffffff, `false` otherwise

tokenURI(uint256).details: Throws if `_tokenId` is not a valid SBT. URIs are defined in RFC  3986. The URI may point to a JSON file that conforms to the "ERC721  Metadata JSON Schema".

params.tokenId: SBT to get the URI of

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: Soulbound Two-factor authentication (2FA)

addAuthority(address).notice: Adds a new authority to the list of authorities

addErc20Token(address).notice: Adds a new ERC20 token as a valid payment method

constructor.notice: Creates a new soulbound Two-factor authentication (2FA)

getIdentityId(uint256).notice: Returns the identityId owned by the given token

removeErc20Token(address).notice: Removes an ERC20 token as a valid payment method

setMasaToken(address).notice: Sets the utility token to pay the fee in ($MASA)

setMintingPrice(uint256).notice: Sets the price of minting in stable coin

setSoulboundIdentity(address).notice: Sets the SoulboundIdentity contract address linked to this SBT

setStableCoin(address).notice: Sets the stable coin to pay the fee in (USDC)

setWrappedNativeToken(address).notice: Sets the wrapped native token address

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Query if a contract implements an interface

tokenURI(uint256).notice: A distinct Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for a given asset.

userdoc.notice: Soulbound token that represents a Two-factor authentication (2FA)
